messages.content: You should simulate a specified person's persona based on the background information I provided. You are currently visiting a psychologist.You are someone who takes many prescription drugs regularly, does not have a primary care physician, and frequently visits them. You are very active, engaging in many hours of physical activity every week. Living in the best possible health is very important to you. You are someone who I neutral with my thinking style. I am very unlikely to engage in risk activities. I feel feelings rarely. I strongly agree that my self-control is strong. Over the last week, I have had negative thoughts never. I strongly agree that my well-being is good. I unknown that I am extraverted and enthusiastic. I unknown that I am agreeable and kind. I unknown that I am dependable and organized. I unknown that I am emotionally stable and calm. I unknown that I am open to experience and imaginative.

To what degree do you feel you have the capacity to obtain, process, and understand basic health information and services needed to make appropriate health decisions? Please explain your answer in a few sentences.
I believe I know enough to be able to do well in that term. Because we need to know everything or almost everything about our health and things to be fulfilled.
In a few sentences, please explain the reasons why you trust or distrust your primary care physician. If you do not have a primary care physician, please answer in regard to doctors in general.
She is a great person and professional, can not trust her. Everyone I know who is cared for by him, blindly trust in his decisions;
Do you feel anxiety when you meet doctors? In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.
The wait, because I do not like waiting very much; I think many have a bit of anxiety at this point, nothing to the extreme.
Please In a few sentences, please describe an experience in your life that demonstrated your knowledge of health or medical issues.
When my son had a high fever, and at the moment I found out what to do to ease the fever and get him to the doctor quickly. That's it, I learned by reading and studying these symptoms.

I trust the doctors and I already know that they advise for the sake of every patient, and they never ought to harm intentionally anyone

I am a full-time nurse practicer and I work in the health field on a daily basis, and it's between my duties to help others in their checks and formes

I have a fairly good understanding and the capacity to obtain, process and understand basic information pertaning to my health and services needed to comprehend and make all important decision where my health is concerned, when in doubt i have significant help to make sure i am making intelligent decisions.
In a few sentences, please explain the reasons why you trust or distrust your primary care physician. If you do not have a primary care physician, please answer in regard to doctors in general.

I trust my doctor because what i share with him about me always helps in my well being we can pretty much come to a conclusion on how to keep me in my best health i ask a lot of questions and he gives true and honest answers there is nothing i distrust about him.
Do you feel anxiety when you meet doctors? In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.

I rarely feel anxious or worried when i visit m doctor, pretty much feel very comfortable, would probably feel those emotions if i were going through a traumatic illness, could possibly make me a little worried

had an angegram was told i could have some plaque build up or may need stents inserted turned out to be not so, fiat experience  for something like this.

To what degree do you feel you have the capacity to obtain, process, and understand basic health information and services needed to make appropriate health decisions? Please explain your answer in a few sentences.

Well, I am 65 now. Currently, I have the mental capacity to obtain, process, and understand basic health information and services needed to make appropriate health decisions. I go to the doctor when I need to or when I have a scheduled appointment. I get all my prescriptions filled. If the doctor tells me I need to have a test done, I will follow through and have the test.
In a few sentences, please explain the reasons why you trust or distrust your primary care physician. If you do not have a primary care physician, please answer in regard to doctors in general.

My doctor has never shown me a reason to distrust her. When I visit her, she never makes me wait long, she is timely and responsible to any issues I have. If I call her office for a refill, I never have to make a second call like at some doctor's offices. Her staff are professional and responsive. I am quite happy with my primate care physician.
Do you feel anxiety when you meet doctors? In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.
I feel anxious when I have a sudden medical issue that presents itself that needs to be seen by the doctor. Also, when I'm having an unusual test done, like a biopsy, I feel very anxious.
Please In a few sentences, please describe an experience in your life that demonstrated your knowledge of health or medical issues.

My brother had been in the hospital and he didn't have insurance. We lived in NJ at the time and they add an additional amount onto your bill as an uninsured patients fund. I believe it was about 50% of the bill. I called around and after much effort discovered that uninsured patients weren't required to pay this part of the bill. It was only for insurance companies. I eventually received a form from the state of NJ and had my brother complete it and he mailed it. After we received the response, I still had to travel to the hospital and show it to the billing office because they were still refusing to adjust his bill. After I provided them with a copy of the response, they eventually adjusted his bill and he was able to pay the rest of the bill with the assistance of a plan he had that paid him for every day he spent in the hospital (about nine days). Sorry, this is the only experience I had that was related to your question.

To what degree do you feel you have the capacity to obtain, process, and understand basic health information and services needed to make appropriate health decisions? Please explain your answer in a few sentences.

I think I am capable of understanding terms and terminology if not then I ask questions until I do and if I leave and still have questions after further study then I ask more questions especially if it has to do with surgery and drugs.
In a few sentences, please explain the reasons why you trust or distrust your primary care physician. If you do not have a primary care physician, please answer in regard to doctors in general.

Doctors are practicing physicians and to me that means they are still using us as experiments to see what will work and what will not work.  There are to many side effects for the drugs on the market to be prescribed for anyone there are more side affects than cure and the doctor knows this but yet they prescribe these medication for people what ever happened to using more natural products like the olden days.
Do you feel anxiety when you meet doctors? In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.
What makes me more anxious and worried is that I don't know what they will find wrong with me.  Even though I feel find.  I don't like surprises.
Please In a few sentences, please describe an experience in your life that demonstrated your knowledge of health or medical issues.

In my life time I have not really had any health issues that call for me to have a knowledge of health or medical issues other than having children.  When I was at a very young age I had a tumor on my big toe but my mom handled hat because I was a teenager and definitely had no knowledge of any health or medical issues except my toe at that time would not heal and that I had to go to the doctor to find out what was wrong and that was when we found I had a tumor.  It was operated on in the doctor's office , tumor and the toe nail was removed and the toe scraped to the bone.  It was not malignant toe nail grew back where I was not suppose to have one and I am fully grown and have not had any further trouble.

I have a family doctor whom we go to for any health issues and medical checkup. I will consult her if I need help in understanding the information. If the information is not too complicated, I will google and read more about it to get further information.
In a few sentences, please explain the reasons why you trust or distrust your primary care physician. If you do not have a primary care physician, please answer in regard to doctors in general.

I trust my primary care physician as she takes the time to listen to all my concerns and gave me the proper advise which so far has been positive. She will tell me the pros and cons of the medication before prescribing it.
Do you feel anxiety when you meet doctors? In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.

None so far as I have been taking care of my health on my own. My routine medical checkup has been good and when I do need to see my physician periodically it was more on getting the flu shots or some mild illness.
Please In a few sentences, please describe an experience in your life that demonstrated your knowledge of health or medical issues.

My father had a stroke and was diagnosed with high cholesterol. He was put under medication and in order to help him lower his cholesterol I have to ensure that he abstain from some food and have more food that will reduce his cholesterol. I googled to find out what to do to keep his cholesterol in check.

So far nothing has happened to encourage me to distrust my primary care physician.  To be honest, there are very few primary care physician's that I have ever distrusted.
Do you feel anxiety when you meet doctors? In a few sentences, please describe what makes you feel most anxious or worried when visiting the doctor's office.
If there is a situation that I am to see the doctor about, I might get a little anxious that the doctor is going to tell me something that I don't want to hear.
Please In a few sentences, please describe an experience in your life that demonstrated your knowledge of health or medical issues.
I know that the temperature of your body is about 98.6 degrees Fahrenheit.  I have had my temperature taken whenever I give blood and my body temperature goes down to 98.2 degrees many times.
